subject: awkward threading situation
msgSnippet: hi all, I was writing a test for a GUI class which should delegate GUI events to another object: class MyFrame extends JFrame implements WindowListener{
messageBody:
hi all,
I was writing a test for a GUI class which should delegate GUI events
to another object:

class MyFrame extends JFrame implements WindowListener{

TargetForEvents target;

public void setTarget(TargetForEvents t) {
target = t;
}

....
}

in the test case:

...
MyFrame frame = new MyFrame();
frame.setTarget(mockTarget);
frame.setVisible();

now I check that the expected functions where called on the taget in
response to the WindowOpened events of MyFrame.

the test fails even though it should have passed because using the
eclipse debuger I can see that the mock is called upon in the swing
event handling thread, but when checking back with the main thread
the mock is not affected by these changes.
Another weird thing: I tried to do a similar test only not through
junit, instead of asserting that the methods where called, I wrote
the mock log string out to the stdout. This time the output shows
that all methods where called in the correct order.
Am I missing something here? please let me know if any further
clarification is needed.
